intro: Taeniophyllum graptolitum, commonly known as the golden star moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a distinct appearance with bright yellow to golden-green leaves that are arranged in a star-like pattern. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are borne on short stalks and contain spores for dispersal. This plant plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
